title: Zamindar
summary: Zamindar, zomindar, zomidar, jomidar (Persian: زَمیندار‎, romanized: zamindār; Bengali: জমিদার), or jamidar (Odia: ଜମିଦାର) is a term for a landowner in India. It was introduced during the Mughal period. Typically hereditary, zamindars held enormous tracts of land and control over their peasants, from whom they reserved the right to collect tax on behalf of imperial courts or for military purposes.
